attachments.fallback: [April 8th, 2021 1:28 PM] paresh2047: is there another package apart from Interpolations.jl which offers splines? Ideally one which can work with Flux
attachments.text: is there another package apart from Interpolations.jl which offers splines? Ideally one which can work with Flux

text: There are some upsampling functions in Flux now, and we have a GSoC out there for people who want to see more image processing become differentiable.

elements.text: There are some upsampling functions in Flux now, and we have a GSoC out there for people who want to see more image processing become differentiable.

text: What’s your use case? You might want to open an issue on Flux

elements.text: What’s your use case? You might want to open an issue on Flux

text: there is already an issue on flux and I see you have commented on it now :smile: .

elements.text: there is already an issue on flux and I see you have commented on it now

text: my usecase requires more than upsampling unfortunately. But the most specific description of what I want to do is fit the spline parameters using flux. This will enable me to mix a lot of models together using flux.

elements.text: my usecase requires more than upsampling unfortunately. But the most specific description of what I want to do is fit the spline parameters using flux. This will enable me to mix a lot of models together using flux.

text: That sounds interesting. I'd love to hear more as you progress

elements.text: That sounds interesting. I'd love to hear more as you progress

text: I mean... that's the whole point of differentiable programming, right? I am writing a Pluto notebook, I guess I can host it somewhere and share it here.

elements.text: I mean... that's the whole point of differentiable programming, right? I am writing a Pluto notebook, I guess I can host it somewhere and share it here.

text: Absolutely! I want to hear more about dP projects in general too

elements.text: Absolutely! I want to hear more about dP projects in general too

text: Dierckx.jl links to a fairly standard splines C library, but it won't accept new types.

elements.text: Dierckx.jl links to a fairly standard splines C library, but it won't accept new types.

text: I thought we can't use c libraries in Flux?

elements.text: I thought we can't use c libraries in Flux?

text: I don't think so either. I was listening to the "ideally" part. :slightly_smiling_face: Hey, I have a question. Does Interpolations.jl not work for your use case? Does it not work with Flux?

elements.text: I don't think so either. I was listening to the "ideally" part.
Hey, I have a question. Does Interpolations.jl not work for your use case? Does it not work with Flux?

text: Well, why not? I recall it's pure Julia. Did you find it had trouble with other types?

elements.text: Well, why not? I recall it's pure Julia. Did you find it had trouble with other types?

text: Interpolations.jl doesn't work with Flux. More details in this fresh issue <https://github.com/JuliaMath/Interpolations.jl/issues/396>

elements.text: Interpolations.jl doesn't work with Flux. More details in this fresh issue

text: So the issue seems to be in some non standard way they use WeightedIndex. Wait I will find the other issue which lists the error

elements.text: So the issue seems to be in some non standard way they use WeightedIndex. Wait I will find the other issue which lists the error

text: Thanks! I was asking because I need to _integrate_ an interpolation, so I was poking in Interpolations.jl to see how to implement that. It does seem to me like it would take some work.

elements.text: Thanks! I was asking because I need to
integrate
an interpolation, so I was poking in Interpolations.jl to see how to implement that. It does seem to me like it would take some work.

text: I cant seem to find the issue/stackoverflow where they mention the error. I am writing a Pluto notebook for this, I will reproduce it there and get back to you

elements.text: I cant seem to find the issue/stackoverflow where they mention the error. I am writing a Pluto notebook for this, I will reproduce it there and get back to you

text: But, the problem is with Flux+Interpolations. If you just want to work with splines then all the functionality is in Interpolations.jl

elements.text: But, the problem is with Flux+Interpolations. If you just want to work with splines then all the functionality is in Interpolations.jl

text: it has both gradient and interpolation functions I think

elements.text: it has both gradient and interpolation functions I think

text: It does have both of those. May be a chunk of work to give it type-stability for autodiff.

elements.text: It does have both of those. May be a chunk of work to give it type-stability for autodiff.

text: the issue I linked above makes me believe its not that much work. My noob level debugging suggests that gradient function is actually defined in only a few places.

elements.text: the issue I linked above makes me believe its not that much work. My noob level debugging suggests that gradient function is actually defined in only a few places.

text: You're cracking me up. I hope so.

elements.text: You're cracking me up. I hope so.

text: Do you mean I am joking? I am not joking.

elements.text: Do you mean I am joking? I am not joking.
